page.title: 09THE HARBOUR MASTER,ST.HELIER
page.content: The present Harbour Master is Mr. Bullen, a position he has held for the past 5 years. The position of Harbour Master is very old and long ago each small harbour, eg. St.Aubin, had its own Harbour Master but now there is just one Harbour Master of Jersey. He is responsible for the maintenance of all harbours, buoys, lighthouses, etc. He also has to keep the shipping channels clear of wrecks. The Harbour Master has 110 people working under him, including painters, carpenters and office staff who deal with enquiries from the public and send out bills for harbour dues. These are paid by ship owners and travellers and help to maintain the harbours. For example Â£1 of the cost of a single ticket to England is a Harbour due.
